original: Fridlund, Ture Hilding Timotheus, läroverksadjunkt, Växjö, f. 9/5/89 i Malmö av överlär. Jöns F. o. Elsa Oihlsson. G. 19 m. Liilly Södergren. Barn: Lisa o. Greta ff. 26. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 07, fil. kand. i Lund 10, fil. mag. 11. Stud:res. t. Tyskl., Holl., Frankr. o. Belg. E. o. aman. v. fys. inst. i Lund 11, e. ilär. i Halmstad 11-14 o. 15, v. Gbgs latin 15-16, adj. i matem. o. fysik v. Växjö h. a. 1. sed. 16, timlär. v. Växjö komm. flicksk. sed. 30. Led. av drätselkamm. 17-39, ordf. i Växjö tenniskl. sed. 18, sekr. o. kassör i Drottn. Josephines räddnianst. sed. 25, led. av styr. f. Växjö komm. flicksk. o. h. a. 1., dir. f. Växjö idr:-halil sed. 38. RVO 40.
translated: Fridlund, Ture Hilding Timotheus, high school teacher, Växjö, b. May 9, 1889 in Malmö to chief inspector Jöns F. and Elsa Oihlsson. Married in 1919 to Liilly Södergren, with children Lisa and Greta born in 1926. Graduated from Malmö high school in 1907, received a bachelor's degree from Lund University in 1910, and a master's degree in 1911. Studied abroad in Germany, the Netherlands, France, and Belgium. Worked as a assistant teacher at a physics institute in Lund from 1911, as a substitute teacher in Halmstad 1911-1914 and 1915, at Goteborg's Latin School from 1915-1916, as a mathematics and physics teacher at Växjö high school from 1916, and as a part-time teacher at Växjö municipal girls' school from 1930. Was a member of the municipal board from 1917-1939, chairman of the Växjö Tennis Club from 1918, secretary and treasurer of the Drottning Josephine Rescue Association from 1925, a member of the board for Växjö municipal girls' school and high school, and director for Växjö sports hall from 1938. Received the Royal Order of Vasa in 1940.

memberOf.name: Växjö Municipal Girls' School and High School
